thread.title: US skier Ligety wins season-opening World Cup giant slalom
thread.title_full: US skier Ligety wins season-opening World Cup giant slalom

title: US skier Ligety wins season-opening World Cup giant slalom
text:
World GS champion Ligety leads rival Hirscher by 0.17 after 1st run of World Cup opening GS THE ASSOCIATED PRESS   6:44   6:44   
People: 
Austria (29) 

SOELDEN, Austria — Ted Ligety of the United States posted the fastest time in the first run of the season-opening men's World Cup giant slalom on Sunday. 
The Olympic and world champion, who has won here three times, led long-term rival Marcel Hirscher of Austria by 0.17, with Thomas Fanara of France sitting 0.33 behind in third. 
Robert Nani of Italy was another 0.30 back in fourth, while the rest of the field trailed the American by at least 1.46 seconds. 
Ligety has dominated the discipline since 2012 but was beaten for the GS title by Hirscher last year. The Austrian also won his fourth overall title. 
Norwegians Kjetil Jansrud and Aksel Lund Svindal, expected to be Hirscher's closest competitors for the overall championship, finished more than three seconds off the lead.
